intro: Jacquemontia velloziana, commonly known as the yellow velvetleaf, is a member of the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas. Jacquemontia velloziana is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
